definition: a step up/to rise to the next level
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: If excellent work results in frequent pay increases or promotions.
sentences.chinese: 如果工作出色能经常得到加薪提级。

sentences.english: I believe accelerated promotion is justified and I should have it now.
sentences.chinese: 我相信提前晋升是有根据的，现在就给我提级。

definition: multiple track (e.g. rail)/multi-lane (e.g. highway)/the complex line (math.)
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
to open to traffic (e.g. new bridge, rail line etc)/(of a locality) to have a transportation service/(Tw) to commute
along the line (e.g. railway)/the region near the line
to reconsider/to reexamine/to review (e.g. a report prior to accepting it)
to reply officially to a subordinate
to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)
